abstract: News Analysis; House Speaker John A Boehner's decision to resign from his position spares House contentious vote to remove him, but does not make his successor's job any easier; whoever takes over must still find ways to govern amid political division and to appease House conservatives.
lead_paragraph: Whoever takes over will be under pressure to confront Democrats and the White House more strongly, meaning the job probably won’t get any easier.

headline.main: John Boehner Successor Is Likely to Face Similar Problems

snippet: Whoever takes over will be under pressure to confront Democrats and the White House more strongly, meaning the job probably won’t get any easier.
